document.masterDocTitle: Description of eleven new species of phytoseiid mites (Acari: Mesostigmata) from Meghalaya state, north eastern India

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Description of eleven new species of phytoseiid mites (Acari: Mesostigmata) from Meghalaya state, north eastern India

mods:name.mods:affiliation: Department of Agricultural Entomology, Bidhan Chandra Krishi Viswavidyalaya, Mohanpur- 741252, Nadia, West Bengal, India. & anamika _ kar 7 @ rediffmail. com; https: // orcid. org / 0000 - 0001 - 5318 - 8308

Department of Agricultural Entomology, Bidhan Chandra Krishi Viswavidyalaya, Mohanpur- 741252, Nadia, West Bengal, India. & kkbckv 64 @ gmail. com; karmakar. krishna @ bckv. edu. in; https: // orcid. org / 0000 - 0002 - 5582 - 3560

heading.emphasis:
Key to the Indian species of
Euseius
described or reported from India .

paragraph.keyLead:
2. All the macrosetae of leg IV spatulated..........................................
E . macrospatulatus ( Gupta, 1986 )

keyLead.keyStep:
4. Spermatheca short, tubular, flared at atrium...............................................
E . ovalis ( Evans, 1953 )
- Spermatheca elongated, tubular, not flared at atrium...............................
E . sacchari ( Ghai & Menon, 1967 )

paragraph.keyLead: 5. Ventrianal shield vase-shaped, no forward migration of JV2 and ZV2 ............................................ 6
- Ventrianal shield pentagonal with forward migration of JV2 and ZV2 ........................................... 10
7. Setae j1 , j3 and Z4 same in length, macrosetae present on genu, tibia and tarsus.................................... 8
- Setae j3 longer than j1 and Z4 , macrosetae present only on tarsus............................................... 9

9. Peritreme extended beyond j3 , single pair of metapodal shields..........................
E . chitradurgae ( Gupta, 1986 )

- Peritreme extended up to the base of z2 , two pairs of metapodal shields................
E . kalimpongensis ( Gupta, 1969c )

12. Sternal shield longer than wide................................................
E . papayensis ( Sadanandan, 2006 )

- Sternal shield as long as wide..................................................
E . rhododendronis ( Gupta, 1970 a)

15. R1 on the dorsal shield.........................................
E . bandispermathecae Pramanik & Karmakar, 2016

16. Tip of macrosetae blunt, atrium indistinct..................................
E . astrictus Karmakar & Bhowmik, 2018

17. Calyx tubular, annulated at the base of vesicle and flared at atrium.................................
E . fascae
sp. nov.

- Calyx tubular, annulated and narrow at atrium.................................
E . prasadi Chant & McMurtry, 2005 c
18. Calyx of spermatheca constricted at base and flared at atrium................................................. 19
- Calyx of spermatheca not constricted at base and not flared at atrium........................................... 22

20. Leg macrosetae with hyaline tip...........................................
E . sajnekhalicus Kar & Karmakar, 2021

24. Macrosetae of leg IV capitate, movable digit toothless.....................................
E . coccinae Gupta, 1975

- Macrosetae of leg IV not capitate, movable digit with teeth..............
E . sundarbanensis Karmakar & Bhowmik, 2018

26. All lateral setae long, S4 always reaches base of S5..................................
E . vignus Rishi & Rather, 1983

- All lateral setae not long, S4 never reaches base of S5 ...........................
E . mangiferae ( Ghai & Menon, 1967 )

- j1 shorter or equal length of j3 ...............................................
E . bambusae ( Ghai & Menon, 1967 )

30. Ventrianal shield triangular, 60 long, 40 wide at ZV2 ................................
E . neococcineae ( Gupta, 1978c )
.

- Ventrianal shield pentagonal, 100–105 long, 45–50 wide at ZV2................
E . bomdilae Pramanik & Karmakar, 2016
